title: [SOLVED]820-2850-A Random shut downs Panic Report CPU
message:
Hi there,

I have a MBP here that shuts down randomly between 5 minutes and 10 hours. Panic report says: (cpu 0 caller 0xffffff801b805ead). Full report
attached. Possible water damage from a year ago but inspection did not reveal any corrosion. Just in case I put in ultrasonic machine to make sure nothing is stuck under the IC components. 
How do I even begin to diagnose something like this?

Thanks!

title: [SOLVED]820-2850-A Random shut downs Panic Report CPU
message: As a rule, always replace C9560 with a regular capacitor, not tantalum...

title: [SOLVED]820-2850-A Random shut downs Panic Report CPU
message:
Thanks for your reply. Any preference for not tantalum capacitor? Can I use 330uf 10V Aluminium Electrolytic Capacitor?

Thanks.

title: [SOLVED]820-2850-A Random shut downs Panic Report CPU
message: if you have 820-2915 donors, there is quite a few 330uF non-tant capacitors on there.

title: [SOLVED]820-2850-A Random shut downs Panic Report CPU
message: Any Apple board will have 330uf normal size caps on it.

title: [SOLVED]820-2850-A Random shut downs Panic Report CPU
message:
No Title

Please check the picture attached and correct me if I am wrong?

title: [SOLVED]820-2850-A Random shut downs Panic Report CPU
[SOLVED]820-2850-A Random shut downs Panic Report CPU
message: Many thanks. Just out of curiosity why tantalum caps are not good for this job? and what are the other ones then?

title: [SOLVED]820-2850-A Random shut downs Panic Report CPU
[SOLVED]820-2850-A Random shut downs Panic Report CPU
message: Thank you for your help. New capacitor did the trick. After 12 hours no random shut downs no more.
